alert.note: Alert for Lackawanna; Luzerne; Wyoming (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 4:18PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Lackawanna, north central Luzerne and southeastern Wyoming Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 418 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Harveys Lake, or 9 miles northwest of Wilkes-Barre, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Scranton, Falls, Old Forge, Taylor, Exeter, Vernon, Swoyersville, Duryea, Larksville and Lehman. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 476 near 122. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
